title: Updated wording and slight consistancy changes
ES2015 has multi line strings
body: Have you encountered a significant performance hit when multiline strings wrapped in backticks as opposed to concatenating them?

title: docs: babel-eslint not neede since 1.0.0 any more
0.1.1 on npm?
body:
Could you please publish 0.1.1 on npm? :)
Thanks!

title: update `eslint`
body: This updates `eslint`, `eslint-plugin-react`, and `tape` to the latest version. It also removes the `babel-eslint` dependency, which fixes #565.

title: [eslint] remove id length rule (too much nutrage)
Allow flow type comments
id-length exceptions
body:
- `$` and `_` should be allowed, as these are frequent for libraries
- `x`, `y`, `z` can't really be made longer
-  `e` is frequently used for the event object

May have forgotten a few

title: [6.5] add backticks around stray eval. fixes #556
body: Thanks to @mjkaufer for pointing this out! :beers:

title: Why is babel-eslint required?
body: ESLint supports all of ES6 plus the experimental object rest/spread that React uses. Is it possible to remove babel-eslint as a dependency? (It would make linting faster.)

title: Update redirects
body: Created with https://github.com/dkhamsing/frankenstein

title: ESLint: excempt '$' and '_' from 'id-length' rule
body:
Because '$' and '_' and commonly used as identifiers for the jQuery
and lodash libraries respectively. This commit adds both identifiers to
the 'id-length' rule exception list.

title: Start to write a realistic "testing" section
body: Closes #392.

title: eslint: Fix `no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs` turn off
body:
Currently the way the rule is defined, mixing spaces and tabulations in
indentation is allowed. However, the comments and documents seems to say
the opposite.

This patchs turns the rule on so mixing spaces and tabs is NOT allowed.

Fixes: #539

title: modification of variables declared using `const` keyword should raise eslint error
body: See discussion in issue #559.

title: why disable `no-const-assign` in eslint es6 config?
body:
On [es6.js, line 35](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blame/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/es6.js#L35), the [`no-const-assign`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-const-assign.html) config is disabled, but reassigning a `const` seems like the sort of thing one would want to get warned about.

Is this on purpose? If so, can you explain the reasoning?

title: J query new feature about some rules of jQuery plugins
Changed syntax highlighting from JavaScript to es6
body: Also added a code block around a stray `eval()`

title: eslint: Add missing `space-before-keywords` rule
Adding JavaScript Design Patterns
body:
I think is very important to mention them.

I added some patterns like singleton, observer, mediator, in order to contribute to the best programming practices.

title: Only allow one blank line between blocks and at EOF
body:
Currently, the [style.js](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/98a76908fcf605221e6b85849f0d058b886741bd/packages/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/style.js#L54) enforces at most two lines:

```
// disallow multiple empty lines
'no-multiple-empty-lines': [2, {'max': 2}],
```

Should this follow [this suggestion](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#18.7) to enforce the max blank line to only 1?

Besides, this will affect the allowed blank line at the end of the file, too.

title: `export default` should not be inline with the class declaration
body: When there are static variables like `propTypes` and `defaultProps`, we shouldn't export them until we have actually set them onto the `Component`. This may change if the current ES7 proposal for static class properties gets accepts, and we update to support it.

title: Constructor using class statement - Browser doesn't allow it
test-base-edits
body: Verify test order.

title: consistent-return and promises
Prohibit Padded Blocks and Allow Comments in the First Line of a Block
body:
In #483, @justjake says that we should amend the style guide to allow single line comments in the first line of a block. I updated 17.2 with this change.

In addition, our ESLint config file prohibits padded blocks, so I decided to make a section 18.8 to address that.

title: New feature for Classes and Objects definition
body: It is very important to consider OOP, because one of the most important aspects writing maintainable code is being able to notice the recurring themes in that code and optimize them.
